solution_line_template: Hector gave to Alisha twice as many as he had given Todd, for a total of {gumballs_to_todd}*{multiplier_twice}=<<{gumballs_to_todd}*{multiplier_twice}={gumballs_to_alisha}>>{gumballs_to_alisha} gumballs,

Hector gave {less_than_four_times} less than four times as many to Bobby as he had given to Alisha, or a total of ({gumballs_to_alisha}*{multiplier_four_times})-{less_than_four_times}=<<{gumballs_to_alisha}*{multiplier_four_times}-{less_than_four_times}={gumballs_to_bobby}>>{gumballs_to_bobby} gumballs.

If Hector had {gumballs_remaining} gumballs remaining, he originally purchased {gumballs_to_todd}+{gumballs_to_alisha}+{gumballs_to_bobby}+{gumballs_remaining}=<<{gumballs_to_todd}+{gumballs_to_alisha}+{gumballs_to_bobby}+{gumballs_remaining}={total_gumballs_purchased}>>{total_gumballs_purchased} gumballs.
